results.title: Australia Felix
results.brief_description: Tom Robert’s paintings portray aspects of Australia’s history. Surveys many of his paintings which show the early history of the Australian way of life. Tom Roberts (1856-1931) travelled in Spain and applied the knowledge gained overseas in starting a new trend in Australian painting - scenes of casual human interest.

results.title: Australia builds
results.creator_credit: Dept of Public Information and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Australia is playing her part as a member of the United Nations family by giving a home and new life to many Europeans. But to continue to feed her growing population she has had to develop her resources to a greater extent; the Snowy Mountains project is one way in which she is doing this. Australia has also found it necessary to buy machinery and equipment from dollar countries. Dollars are in short supply, but as a member of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the Government has been able to negotiate a series of dollar loans.

results.title: Australia at War 1914-1918: an Account of the Australian Force in the Great War
results.creator_credit: Barrie Pattison, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian War Memorial
results.brief_description: This detailed account of “the war to end all wars” comprises actual footage shot on the battlefields of Europe and the Middle East. Commencing with troops leaving Australia, it documents the major battles campaigns of Australian and New Zealand troops including those in Egypt, the Somme and Cambrai in which 60,000 Australians died. Shows rare footage from the only roll of film taken at Gallipoli and includes footage from the work of Hubert Wilkins and Frank Hurley acquired from the archives of the Australian War Memorial.

results.title: Australia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Richard Mason, Film Australia and Tourism Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion film showing all of the major regions of Australia. Includes fauna, recreation activities, natural features and urban scenes. Non-narrated. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Austinmere wheat and sheep farm
results.creator_credit: Edwin Moses, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Views the life, work, seasonal operations, problems and uncertain outlook of an integrated wheat and sheep farm in the central west of New South Wales. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Auslang = Australian supply language
results.brief_description: About creating order from confusion and adapting a more disciplined approach to inventory identification in industry. Standard names are vital and AUSLANG (Australian Supply Language) offers a comprehensive dictionary together with colloquial cross references thus reducing the incidence of duplication of stock. AUSLANG was derived from the NATO codification system for Australian Industry use

results.title: The Audition
results.creator_credit: C B Wismar and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: A young man comes into a seemingly empty theatre for an audition. He is not given a script but it is clear to the invisible director that he can portray surprise & anger can he portray love? Understanding? Pity? Concern? An allegorical tale of life, the young man it appears is the director as well.

results.title: Attitude gyro
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Sperry Gyroscope Co
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the Sperry attitude gyro in action in a P-47 fighter. Explains that this aeronautical instrument provides a visual indication of the position of an aircraft, with reference to the earth’s surface, throughout all possible attitudes in when a plane can be manoeuvred. The instrument is adaptable to other types of aircraft.
